channel.description: Recent content in literatures on Chloe Jo

item.title: Beyond Good and Evil - Ch1 Prejudices of Philosophers
item.description: 1 . Nietzsche starts the first chapter of the book by questioning the “Will of Truth” - if there’s a will to truth, why not untruth? Nietzsche pointed that philosophers devoted themselves to the “Will of Truth” without questioning the origin of the will. He also mentioned such question is Dangerous. Background Sphnix and Oedipus Sphnix is a mythical creature with a head of a human, the body of a lion and the wings of a falcon.

item.title: Beyond Good and Evil
item.description: tags Philosophy keywords Existentialism Motivation for reading Memo Quote Background Impression Reading log <2022-11-16 Wed> : Reading Progress : 1% I was attempated to read it faster then realize I can’t understand anything if reading at that pace… So my current goal is to read at least one section a day and build a more solid understanding of the book. <2022-11-16 Wed> : Reading Progress : 2% Ch1S2, Nietzsches questions why the values have to steam from good but not from evil more destructive motives… but I don’t understand the meaning of the antithesis of value so I am very confused about the paragraph… By chapter Ch1 Prejudices of Philosophers Relevant

item.title: Notes for The Brothers Karamazov
item.description: tags Fiction/Classics author Fyodor Dostoevsky Motivation for reading Heavily referenced in Camus’ Rabel. Memo Quote Ivan’s view of the physical world and religion I have a Euclidian earthly mind, and how could I solve problems that are not of this world? And I advise you never to think about it either, my dear Alyosha, especially about God, whether He exists or not. All such questions are utterly inappropriate for a mind created with an idea of only three dimensions.
